summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting an interview with a BOP Captain from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding the supervision and death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The Captain details Epstein's housing status, manipulative behavior, the July 23 incident, and the circumstances leading up to his death on August 10, 2019, including failures in protocol regarding cellmate assignment and rounds.

connections.description: The Captain was responsible for overseeing security and Epstein's supervision at MCC, interacting with him approximately three times.
The Captain reports to the Warden, who directed that Epstein must have a cellmate. The Captain compiled and vetted cellmate candidates for the Warden's review.
The Captain directly supervises Lieutenant, the SHU Lieutenant, and repeatedly directed him that Epstein needed a cellmate at all times.
Epstein was housed with a cellmate, selected after vetting, following the Warden's directive. The cellmate flagged staff on July 23, and Epstein later accused him of an attack.
The Captain notified the Associate Warden immediately after learning of Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive on the floor of his cell with a homemade piece of fabric on his chest. His cellmate flagged staff. Epstein was revived and claimed his cellmate tried to take his life.

events.title: Epstein's Last Day Alive
events.description: Epstein had an attorney session. His cellmate was at court and later released. Epstein was left without a cellmate in his SHU cell, contrary to the Warden's directive.

events.title: Epstein Found Dead
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell without a cellmate in the early morning hours. He was pronounced dead, an apparent suicide.

events.title: FBI Interview of BOP Captain
events.description: The BOP Captain was interviewed by FBI and OIG agents regarding the supervision and death of Jeffrey Epstein at MCC.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at MCC on the morning of August 10, 2019.

Despite a direct order from the Warden that Epstein must have a cellmate at all times, he was alone in his cell on the night of his death because his cellmate had been released from court and not replaced.
The Captain verbally, but informally, instructed his Lieutenants about the cellmate requirement; no formal meeting or email was sent, leading to a breakdown in communication.
Surveillance cameras in the SHU were reportedly down, and 30-minute rounds and inmate counts for the night of Epstein's death were not properly completed or documented.
Epstein had a prior incident on July 23, 2019, where he was found unresponsive and later accused his cellmate of an attack, after which he was placed on Suicide Watch.
